item.title: Twitter to Developers: Display Tweets Our Way Or Else
item.description: Here's what I wrote: Twitter to Developers: Display Tweets Our Way Or Else http://t.co/kPgHRQ9M
item.content:encoded: Here's what I wrote: Twitter to Developers: Display Tweets Our Way Or Else http://t.co/kPgHRQ9M After months of anticipation, Twitter finally ripped off the Band-Aid Thursday and laid out the changes to how it shares data with developers. The message is as clear as ever: Twitter doesn’t want any client apps that aren’t made by Twitter itself. For those clients that are already out there, the changes will not destroy their business, but unfortunately, what the new guidelines will destroy is the possibility of Twitter streams being integrated into the rest of the Web. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: readwriteweb.com

item.title: Paul Ryan Says He "Never Asked For Stimulus," Contradicts AP Report
item.description: Lyin' Ryan: 'I Never Asked For Stimulus' Money, Contradicts AP Report and 4 letters from him: http://t.co/mwaVBoIE
item.content:encoded: Lyin' Ryan: 'I Never Asked For Stimulus' Money, Contradicts AP Report and 4 letters from him: http://t.co/mwaVBoIE WASHINGTON-- In a television interview with WCPO Cincinnati, Republican vice presidential candidate Rep. Paul Ryan (R-Wis.) directly contradicted an Associated Press report that said he had sought stimulus funds for his congressional district, while at the same time publicly decrying the bill as a "wasteful spending spree." "No, I never asked for stimulus," Ryan said when questioned on reports that he had sought funds. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com
